meanings.definition: Increase the power or capacity of something.
meanings.sent1: I will uprate the engine to make the car faster.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to uprate their production to meet the demand.
meanings.sent3: He tried to uprate his bicycle by adding a rocket booster.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to uprate her skills propelled her to success.
meanings.sent5: The magician used his wand to uprate the rabbit's hopping speed.

meanings.definition: To raise the rating or value of something.
meanings.sent1: The restaurant owner wanted to uprate the quality of their service.
meanings.sent2: The app developer planned to uprate the user experience with new features.
meanings.sent3: The student tried to uprate his test score by studying harder.
meanings.sent4: The real estate agent hoped to uprate the value of the property with renovations.
meanings.sent5: The artist's signature uprated the value of the painting.

meanings.sent1: She decided to uprate her cooking skills by taking a class.
meanings.sent2: The company aimed to uprate their customer service to retain clients.
meanings.sent3: The gardener tried to uprate the beauty of the garden with colorful flowers.
meanings.sent4: The coach's pep talk uprated the team's morale before the game.
meanings.sent5: The new software update uprated the performance of the computer.
